intro: Trientalis borealis, commonly known as the northern starflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the northern regions of North America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many shrubs and flowering plants adapted to acidic soils. The plant features a cluster of small, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are narrow and alternate, often covered in a fine layer of hairs. Trientalis borealis is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest floors and rocky slopes.
